headline: This week’s covers

children.data: , including this one, we publish more than one cover. In most of the world, we explore how fighting climate change and pursuing economic growth are interlinked projects, making the case for an environmentalism that builds.
The case for an environmentalism that builds
The electric grid is about to be transformed
America’s chance to become a clean-energy superpower
Meanwhile, in the United States we explore the issue of gender medicine, and argue that the evidence to support medicalised gender transitions in adolescents is worryingly weak.
What America has got wrong about gender medicine
The evidence to support gender transitions in kids is worryingly weak

bodyText:
Some weeks, including this one, we publish more than one cover. In most of the world, we explore how fighting climate change and pursuing economic growth are interlinked projects, making the case for an environmentalism that builds. 

Leader: The case for an environmentalism that builds
Technology Quarterly: The electric grid is about to be transformed
United States: America’s chance to become a clean-energy superpower
Meanwhile, in the United States we explore the issue of gender medicine, and argue that the evidence to support medicalised gender transitions in adolescents is worryingly weak.

Leader: What America has got wrong about gender medicine.
Briefing: The evidence to support gender transitions in kids is worryingly weak.

parts.description: Britain’s principles for cyberwarfare are a good start

parts.headline: What America’s friends should make of The Trump Show
parts.description: Reasons to be both relaxed and worried

parts.headline: How to fix the International Monetary Fund
parts.description: The fund must get tough on obstructive creditors, but save them a seat at the table

parts.headline: The university lottery
parts.description: Students are veering away from dodgy degrees. Governments should help them
